name: A CRUISE NOWHERE
description:
A nice cruise back from Rostock.
The weather is nice. Feeling sleepy, you decide to head to your room for a nap and wake up in unfamiliar surroundings after a particularly offputting dream. it looks like the ship you were on, but something is off...

Endless hallways.
Mindless men.
Cursed cargo.
Beings from beyond time and space.
You (mostly) alone against forces that you can't really understand.
Can you make your escape from the Armu Roos?

Find out in

A CRUISE NOWHERE

(Yeah, it's also a bit over the top, but that is how things should be)

Features:

  • First-person survival horror adventure gameplay inspired by old-school classics like Resident Evil, Realms Of The Haunting and Clive Barker's Undying!
  • Fight or flee! Use those legs of yours, running is always an option, or use your trusty guns to put the hurt where it's most needed!
  • Inventory Management! Drop useless items in favour of hopefully useful items, shoot carefully to conserve your ammo and you may live to tell the tale!
  • Puzzles to keep that flesh PC of yours vigorous and provide sanity boosts!
  • Darkness and endless hallways aboard a classical passenger cruiser! Remember to use your flashlight!
  • Cosmic horror and beings from beyond are unleashed in this thrilling tale of existential dread! Also there are nazis and sorcerers and more peculiar things aboard this cosmic tangle of a tale.

Known issues
- Various minimal UI issues (text in reader is wonky and floats to the left for example, inventory is sometimes oversized)
- Safe Puzzle may some times bug - just cancel out and try again and it should work
- When completing the demo, the mouse is not visible after returning to menu, just alt-f4 to quit then

If you encounter any new issues please comment here! Would appreciate that a lot.
